edu.mines.jtk.mesh
Class TetMesh.Tet

java.lang.Object
  edu.mines.jtk.mesh.TetMesh.Tet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Enclosing class:
TetMesh
public static class TetMesh.Tet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

One tetrahedron (tet) in the mesh. Each tet references four nodes (A, B, C, and D), and up to four tet neighbors (nabors) opposite those nodes. A null nabor denotes a triangular face (opposite the corresponding node) on the mesh boundary. As viewed from node A, the nodes B, C, and D are in CCW order.

A tet is serializable, but all of its private fields are transient. Those fields are serialized only when the mesh is serialized. Public fields are not transient, and so are valid without the mesh.

See Also:
Serialized Form

                                      float y,

Returns the node referenced by this tet that is nearest to the point with specified coordinates.

Parameters:

Returns:
the node nearest to the point (x,y,z).

tetNabor

public final TetMesh.Tet tetNabor(TetMesh.Node node)
Returns the tet nabor opposite the specified node. The specified node cannot be null, and must be referenced by this tet.

nodeNabor

public final TetMesh.Node nodeNabor(TetMesh.Tet tetNabor)
Returns the node in the specified tet nabor that is opposite this tet. The specified tet nabor cannot be null, and must be referenced by this tet.

nodeNabor

public final TetMesh.Node nodeNabor(TetMesh.Node node)
Returns the node opposite this tet in the tet nabor that is opposite the specified node. The specified node cannot be null. If the tet nabor opposite the specified node is null, then null is returned.

centerSphere

public double centerSphere(double[] c)
Computes the circumcenter of this tet.

Parameters:
c - array of circumcenter coordinates {xc,yc,zc}.
Returns:
radius-squared of circumsphere.

centerSphere

public double[] centerSphere()
Returns the circumcenter of this tet.

Returns:
array of circumcenter coordinates {xc,yc,zc}.

quality

public double quality()
Returns the quality of this tet. Quality is a number between 0 and 1, inclusive. Quality equals 1 for equilateral tets. Quality equals 0 for degenerate tets with co-planar nodes.

Returns:
tet quality.

node - the node.
Returns:
true, if this tet references the node; false, otherwise.
